TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void UploadStringCompletedEventHandler(object sender, UploadStringCompletedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed UploadStringCompletedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a UploadStringCompletedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates asynchronously uploading a string.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the upload completes.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_2.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.uploadstrin_0_2.vb)]
